messages.title: Dear Fellow Resident,
messages.content: In a few days' time, your postal vote for the General Election will arrive. You have a basic but stark choice. If you choose me, you will get a locally born MP who pledges to work full-time for you. Or, you can re-elect the current MP who continues to earn over £5000 per hour in his second job, whilst missing 7 out of 10 votes in parliament - including those on MP's expenses and disclosures of second jobs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Pledges to re-link pensions to wages, and to provide free long-term care.

issues.education: A party which has made huge investments in local schools
issues.environment: A party which aims to make Britain fairer, freer and greener.
issues.governance: Or, you can re-elect the current MP who continues to earn over £5000 per hour in his second job, whilst missing 7 out of 10 votes in parliament - including those on MP's expenses and disclosures of second jobs.
issues.health: And to provide free long-term care.
issues.socialWelfare: Pledges to re-link pensions to wages

leaflet.additionalNotes: The letter emphasizes that the candidate is locally born and contrasts their commitment to full-time service with the current MP's record of earning a high hourly wage on a second job and missing votes in parliament.
